column4: Will the normal Ubuntu installation let me be able to do dual boot? Windows + Ubuntu
So
You mean that if I go through the normal installation
It won't delete Windows?
yes, if windows is installed first, then ubuntu
Yeah i have windows now
it should work without any more configuration
And ubuntu cd with me
i just did that today
I know the men
But someone told me that I should partition.
Use some program of defrag.
Oh, yes. you need some unallocated space for ubuntu
But, how do I do it? I have no idea.
I have Paragon Partition Manager, but I don't know how to use it.
Do you have more than one partition on your PC?
uhmhm, I dont think so
You mean C: and others?
So there's only C: and nothing else?
There is C: and D:
If D: is a hard drive partition, you might want to back it up somewhere, and then delete the partition and remake the ones you need for ubuntu
I moved all od my D: to a friend's PC over the network and wiped the entire partition
then remade a few partitios for ubuntu
could you take a look at this picture and tell me what I need to change? http://www.googlefight.com/index.php?lang=en_GB&word1=Eh+Pretty+Easy&word2=Bob+Lablah
